intro: Dorstenia denticulata, commonly known as the toothed dwarf banana, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Musaceae, which includes bananas and plantains, though it is not a true banana. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescence and unique, often twisted bracts. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a distinctive toothed margin, giving it its common name. Dorstenia denticulata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and compact size.
